metadata.title: How to Edit YouTube Videos 2025: Beginner's Guide
metadata.description: Learn video editing basics for YouTube. Software options, essential techniques, and workflow tips.

hero.headline: How to Edit YouTube Videos
hero.subheadline: Video editing fundamentals. Transform raw footage into engaging content.

sections.content: Good editing makes average footage engaging and great footage exceptional. You don't need expensive software or years of experience to edit effective YouTube videos. Here's a beginner-friendly guide to video editing fundamentals.

content.title: Free Options
content.description: DaVinci Resolve, CapCut, iMovie. Capable for YouTube without cost.

content.title: Paid Options
content.description: Premiere Pro, Final Cut. More features, subscription or one-time cost.

content.title: Mobile Editing
content.description: CapCut, VN Editor. Edit anywhere on phone or tablet.

content.title: J and L Cuts
content.description: Audio leads or trails video. Smooth, professional transitions.

content.title: B-Roll Coverage
content.description: Cutaway footage covers jump cuts. Visual variety.

content.title: Text and Graphics
content.description: Lower thirds, call-outs, chapter titles. Enhance information delivery.

sections.title: Editing Best Practices
content: Cut on action for smooth transitions
Use B-roll to hide jump cuts
Watch for audio pops and clicks

faq.question: Best free editing software?
faq.answer: DaVinci Resolve for power users. CapCut for ease of use. iMovie for Mac users starting out. All produce professional results.

faq.question: How long does editing take?
faq.answer: Varies wildly. Simple talking head: 2-4x footage length. Complex edit: 10x or more. Efficiency improves with practice.

faq.question: What export settings for YouTube?
faq.answer: 1080p or 4K, H.264 codec, 15-30 Mbps bitrate. Most software has YouTube preset. Higher quality = longer upload.

faq.question: Should I learn keyboard shortcuts?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Editing speed increases dramatically. Learn cut, ripple delete, playback controls first. Invest time upfront.
